snippet: Representatives Tom Latham, a Republican, and Leonard L. Boswell, a Democrat, are finding their campaign inextricably tied to the presidential contest.
abstract: Iowa Congressional race between Republican Tom Latham and Democratic challenger Leonard L Boswell, one of the closest in the country, remains inextricably bound to the race for the White House; Iowa has emerged as one of the most contested states between Mitt Romney and Pres Obama, and Latham and Boswell are relying heavily on their candidate's campaign operations for their own success (Series: In Full Swing).
lead_paragraph: Representatives Tom Latham, a Republican, and Leonard L. Boswell, a Democrat, are finding their campaign inextricably tied to the presidential contest.

headline.print_headline: As Two Iowa Incumbents Compete, the White House Race Reverberates
headline.seo: In a Tight Iowa House Race, White House Run Reverberates
headline.main: As Two Iowa Incumbents Compete, the White House Race Reverberates
